title: My Lab Journal
text: This is a template example for lab journaling. Students in the data science courses at the Institute of Entrepreneurship will use this template to learn R for business analytics. Students can replace this text as they wish.

title: My Lab Journal
text:
How to use

Accept the assignment and get your own github repo.
Blog/journal what you are doing in R, by editing the .qmd files.
See the links page for lots of helpful links on learning R.
Change everything to make it your own.
Make sure to render you website every time before you want to upload changes.

title: Probability Theory
text:
1 Assignment 1:

Given that
\(P(S) = 0.3\) and \(P(\overline{S}) = 0.7\) \(P(T/S) = 0.2\) and \(P(\overline{T}/S) = 0.8\) \(P(T/\overline{S}) = 0.6\) and \(P(\overline{T}/\overline{S}) = 0.4\)


Solution

\(P(T\cap S) = P(S) * P(T/S) = 0.3 * 0.2 = 0.06\)
\(P(T\cap \overline{S}) = P(\overline{S}) * P(T/\overline{S}) = 0.7 * 0.6 = 0.42\)
\(P(\overline{T}\cap S) = P(S) * P(\overline{T}/S) = 0.3 * 0.8 = 0.24\)
\(P(\overline{T}\cap \overline{S}) = P(\overline{S}) * P(\overline{T}/\overline{S}) = 0.7 * 0.4 = 0.28\)

Sum of all four probabilities = 1



2 Assignment 2:

Let S = Smartphone, T = Tablet and C = Computer


Solution

The percentage of customers using all three devices: \(P(S\cap T\cap C) = 0.5\%\)
The percentage of customers using at least two devices: \(= 7.3 + 3.3 + 8.8 + 0.5 = 19.9\%\)
The percentage of customers using only one device: \(= 42.3 + 27.8 + 10 = 80.1\%\)




3 Assignment 3:

Given that,
A = product is faulty vs. \(\overline{A}\) = product is flawless B = alarm is triggered vs. \(\overline{B}\) = no alarm \(P(B|A)=0.97\)
\(P(B|\overline{A})=0.01\)
\(P(A)=0.04\)


Solution
By Bayesian Theorem, \(P(A|B) = \frac{P(A|B)*P(A)}{P(B)} = \frac{P(A|B)*P(A)}{P(B|A)*P(A)+P(B|\overline{A})*P(\overline{A})}\)

\(P(\overline{A}|B)=\frac{0.01*0.96}{(0.01*0.96)+(0.97*0.04)}= 0.1983471074 =19.83\%\)
\(P(A|B)=\frac{0.97*0.04}{(0.01*0.96)+(0.97*0.04)}= 0.8016528926 =80.17\%\)

These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a possibility of about 19.83% that the product is flawless and a probability of 80.17% that the product is faulty.
